title.value: Invariant representation driven neural classifier for anti-QCD jet tagging
title.justification: The title encompasses the main theme of the paper, which involves using invariant representation learning to improve neural classifiers for anti-QCD jet tagging and anomaly detection in jet physics.
title.quote: Invariant representation driven neural classifier for anti-QCD jet tagging

extractions.description: This paper explores the use of invariant representation learning to enhance neural-net-based classifiers for the detection of non-QCD signal jets, specifically in the context of reducing QCD backgrounds in jet physics. By employing classification-based anomaly detection frameworks, the study demonstrates potential improvements in tagging efficiency and significance through supervised Standard Model jet classifiers, leveraging inductive biases, and data-augmented mass-invariance. It discusses various models, datasets, and training methodologies, examining their effects on out-of-distribution detection and background rejection in high-energy physics experiments.

type.justification: The nature of the research involves experiments with neural classifiers, various training methods, and datasets to achieve empirical results in jet tagging efficiency and out-of-distribution detection.
type.quote: We present the performance of classifier-based anomalous jet tagging in this section. We first examine the un-decorrelated tagger in generic jet tagging. Then we present the mass correlation and decorrelation effects and their impacts on OoD detection.
